column5: Well, today was possibly my last ice trip of the season and one of the hardest yet...Rob me and my son Jordan started early from Sibbalds PP but took us 30 min to find place to cross the ugly crack...marked lots of fish early but tough bite....got one lost another at the hole and couple more bellow, Rob got one....and then it died,.....bunch of very good fishermen went home empty handed today....very very tough....huge difference with last Sunday...oh well it is fishing Good thing was I avoided been skunked all ice season and all summer season last year.... Overall very good ice season for me with lots of white fish been caught....and not a single laker....hope to find them from the boat in May.... Hope for better this summer season..........let the Boating begin Jordan got wet foot from stepping in the hole, good thing the truck was there so I've dried him up....at the end he was still happy camper and asking when are we going again ha ha ha, in fact he didn't want to leave today  Thanks Rob for the good company again and the last minute trip... Might try on Monday for season close but not sure at this point....  Shore access was OK at the park and at the Salvation Army ....even Willow Beach looked OK when we passed by....  Here is the shot from the day:     Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Nice way to cap the season Emil.  Once again wish I could have joined you!
Nice report !  I was on the west side of the lake and the bite was slow !! Boy was it hot out there today !!  Damn sliders on my sled were sticking !  Time to put the sled away for the year
nice going I hope to get out one more time
Well done Emil; I wasn't sure you were going to get another chance driving out there!
Great report and pic icefisherman With the warm temps..... softwater will come soon Nice whities BTW Thanks for sharing Leechman
